summary: The document is a confidential memorandum from 13 October 1978, addressed to the Chief of the Operations Support Branch, detailing the death of Adrian Fisher Sherman Jr., a former military detailee with a history of heart trouble and previous interest from the agency. It covers the discovery of his body in Monterey, California, on 23 September 1978, the investigation into missing personal items from his apartment, including a controversial document related to a plan to assassinate Fidel Castro, and concludes with the decision to monitor the case for any new developments after briefing the DCI.
key_findings: Adrian Fisher Sherman Jr. died of a heart attack on 23 September 1978 in Monterey, California.
Sherman had a history of heart trouble and was previously of interest to the agency for his military service and later roles.
A missing document, purportedly a plan to assassinate Fidel Castro prepared by Sherman in the early 1970s, raises security concerns.
Personal items were reported missing from Sherman's apartment, with suspicions pointing towards the resident manager.
The case was briefed to the DCI, and no further action was deemed necessary beyond monitoring for new developments.
